result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence Jesse Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court notes 36 days credit against ultimate sentence.
Court remands Defendant into custody of Chippewa County to finish sentence.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Submit to any programs recommended by Agent (including cognitive intervention).
-Regular and random testing.
-Maintain full time employment.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.

-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: to any other sentence currently serving

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Fox, ADA:   Amber L Hahn, DF ATTY:  Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp, DF:  Lawrence Jesse Thomas appeared from jail.  Includes 14CF328 and 14CM9. Case called at 11:05 am. Set for PTC - there is an agreement. State moves to amend count 1 to Possess of meth; 961.41(3g)(e) - class I felony. Court amends to 961.41(3g)(g) possess of meth. and reviews amended charge and maximum penalty. 
DE pleads guilty to Ct 1, as amended. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionaire/waiver of rights with DE. Def understands. Court reviews consequences of a felony conviction. PL Exhibit #1 (test results); O/R. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorneys stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 , as amended. Court waives a PSI however reserves the option for 
On motion of the State, Crt dismisses 14CM9. Sentencing recommendations. Crt orders - S/W, 3 years probation with conditions: 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment.
- $40.00 in costs to St. Croix County Sheriff's Office. Payable through probation. 
- Submit to any programs recommended by agent (including cognitive intervention)
- Court costs of $268.00. Payable through probation. 
- DNA surcharge $200.00. Payable through probation.
- Regular and random testing.
- Maintain full time employment. 
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
36 days credit against any ultimate sentence. Court remands to custody of Chippewa County to finish sentence. Defendant is advised of right to appeal.
